caption: It's incredible.  Well let's just say if you were to leave one of their sandwiches, still wrapped, out on the kitchen table for 5-6 hours then ate it... you would be delighted to find a well balanced morsel that's delicious and filling. Not at all soggy! And it's even better fresh!  Best sandwiches in walking distance without a doubt!

Big Kids Chicago is awesome!! I have been a couple times and each experience has been great. Friendly customer service and the food is delicious. There is a good variety of different sandwiches and appetizers. I’m a big fan! 😀
Yoooooooo. Fire. And those margarita shots... Fire... and thos Bosco sticks.... fire. And them fries.... fire. And that bologna sammy... FIRE

These sandwiches are freakin’ delicious.  Try the fried bologna, you will not regret it.  The service is top-notch as well.  All the staff are fun, kind, and easy to talk to.  When there was a small issue with my GrubHub delivery order, they went the extra mile to fix the problem quickly with personalized attention.  Really fantastic.  So glad this spot is up the street.
Third eye brine
I come here for the Matty.  Sandwiches are good too.

Personally, not a fan of deli meats but they have a ton of playful iterations of classics. I really wish I got their homemade poptarts, hope they restock with that. I've been following them for a while for something that had no basic deli meats like turkey, ham, bologna. So when the pastrami cheese steak popped up, I knew I had to go.  It was as good as I imagined it! Pastrami was smoky and tender with the cheese piled on, you can't go wrong! Bread is nice n chewy with a great toast. The sesame seeds add a nice flavor as well. I don't want to offend any philly folk so I'm not gonna compare it to the OG cheese steak, but highly recommend coming here for that. It's just so good with all the components together. Melty from the cheese with the perfect slight crunch from the toasted bread. Hope this one stays on the menu permanently!
Food was great. Reminded me of mid/late 90s "cuisine"..

If you have friends in the industry, and have ever gone to an “afters” at their place at 4am, these are the types of sandwiches you’re going to get. I imagine myself with Malort and marijuana fueled professional chefs who’ve just been slammed on their shifts, whipping up these amazing creations. Do yourself a favor and check em out!
Love this new edition to Logan. Super yummy sammies. Fried bologna hands down fav. Don’t sleep on their Togo cocktails.

Out of this world sandwich shop. The menu is always changing and evolving so there’s something new and exciting added to their food and cocktail menu every week. A great new addition to Logan Square. My favorite thing is the Space Torpedo and the tang-o-Rita.

What a delightful addition to the neighborhood. Logan was missing a spot like this and Big Kids has really made their mark. The food is phenomenal in terms of taste, preparation, etc. but also exciting as a diner because of the rotating menu. The team always seems to be having a wonderful time which is great to see during such a weird time for the restaurant industry. The cherry on top is that Big Kids does their part by getting involved with the neighborhood and organizations in need. So happy to have this place in the neighborhood! I recommend grabbing your lunch and enjoying it in the square.

Would give it more stars if I could! The menu is like nothing else you’ll find in Chicago. The food is top notch (I mean those fries? Come on... amazing) and the drinks are delicious! The team at Big Kids is incredibly hospitable and generous, always looking to support local charities and businesses. Overall fantastic business I will continue to support.
Big Kids is soooo goooood. The Space Torpedo is out of this world!

Use to loved this place but front desk staff has became an embarrassing joke. This lady with a braid and glasses was so rude, they need to start training their staff better, this is a customer base business.

I was really excited about the concept of Big Kids. We got takeout and I got the only vegan option— the crunch wrap. I really liked the cheese and mayo, and I'm grateful because a lot of non-vegan joints don't bother to have these and they bring so much flavor to any dish. The jalapenos also added delicious heat. However...I feel like this dish was really unsatisfying and not worth the money. It was too sweet for me because of the carrots and not filling because there was zero protein. It was essentially a cloyingly sweet quesadilla. A salty bean or soy option would make this ten times better.

I've been here a half dozen times since they've opened and it is consistently delicious. Love the rotating menus, there's always something new to try and its guaranteed killer. Top-notch Covid protocols for pick-up and awesome hospitality at the same time. Big Kids is ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Best new restaurant in Logan square  Only had two of their sammies so far but honestly the best lunches I’ve had all year.  Their fried chicken sammie and their breakfast sandwich with a an over easy egg in the middle of the bread is to die for.  Very fun 90s vibe and right next to the square, takeout only for now.  Quality sandwiches and some of the best fries I’ve ever had too!

This was the surprise winner of the pandemic take-out orders that I've experienced in 2020.  I LOVE Big Kids, I really do, and here's why. 1) The food.  I ordered The Space Torpedo (a sandwich with turkey, pastrami, cheese, zesty pasta salad,  shredded letty, and tangy onions on a beautiful hoagie/sub roll), WHICH IS A BRILLIANT, BRILLIANT sando.  I had to share it with my father, and I wish I had bought two, because it was one of the most delicious sandwiches, and the zesty pasta salad ON the sandwich itself gives it a SOUL.  The dressing in that pasta salad and the zesty onions are so much better than any vinaigrette you've ever had.  And, the bread. OH THE BREAD.  I'm STILL dreaming of my second date with this beauty.  Also had the Sketty Egg Rolls, which were also surprising, especially to my Asian parents who thought they were Chinese restaurant egg rolls.  What an delicious twist on egg rolls, and sketty (spaghetti) with the banana peppers was so satisfying, and paired very well with each other.  IMHO skip the ranch -- eat it naturally, or not.  You do you.  Up next for me is the Collard Melt!  Oh, oh, oh, I ordered a few different cocktails:  Ecto Cooler, Tang-a-Rita, and the BK Manhattan.  My BIL LOVED the BK Manhattan, but, the Ecto Cooler was the big winner of the three.  I actually put the cocktail into a shaker and shook it with ice, then poured it into a coupe with a lime wheel (a little green on green...still needs some help on garnish), but, OH EM GEE.  I have a hard time describing it's flavor -- it's like a "daiquiri gone wild", and I can't wait until I can sit at the bar and have another (or I'll just buy a couple more to go and have them at home).  I firmly believe that we should be supporting small businesses, especially our restaurants -- as they go out of business, another light that makes this city shine bright goes out. Chefs Ryan and Mason are creative geniuses, and clearly are excellent chefs.  Let's keep them around!  Eat at Big Kids! Go....NOW!!

Hands down THE BEST SANDO SHOP  everything ive ever eaten from here, has been absolutely phenomenal. From the sandos, to the fries, to the sketti egg rolls (tremendous gas) and even the mixers, Big Kids is doing it right and you should not sleep on the food. Ryan and team adapted quite well amidst the pandemic to bring some of the best food to LS in a long time. The utmost hospitality to boot as well shows how resilient people can be. 420 cheers for everyone involved
i know a dog that has snuck the bologna (or remainder of it) sandwich from the person eating it twice now. all three would go back for another

The most fun food I’ve eaten since COVID.  Thankful for a couple of vegan options! The quesadilla was amazing. And my partner loved the fries and space torpedo.  Unique menu, seems like something i would make when having the munchies. But overall will eat again!  Pickup was quick. Easy. And the person who brought me my order was super friendly! (Sorry I didn’t catch your name)  I have already text everyone I know in the city saying they have to try it.
Ok. Every single sandwich I’ve had here is amazing. The fries are amazing. The drinks are amazing. Run here and try as much as you freaking can!!!
Fried bologna, fries, and crunchwrap are the items I have tried. All so good! I'm very excited to try more of their innovative menu items.
The space torpedo was out of this world! And don't forget to get some sketty rolls, you won't be disappointed.

Beams of brilliance! Simply the best! Nothing else like it! Well there’s one place sort of like it, but there’s minimal overlap. Two sandwiches of overlap. I love this place! Would give it ten stars if I could! Full transparency, I’m part owner, and I’ve never been there.

The fried bologna sandwich was 5 stars. You cannot go wrong with that. The crunch wrap was 3.5 stars. I appreciated the concept - but for me, something was missing that needed to tie in the pickled veggies and smoked cheese and tortilla. Can't quite put my finger on it. After taxes/tip, it comes out to $16 per sandwich, which isn't quite worth it for a repeat visit from me..
Exelent place to buy chairbroil chicken delicius mmm
The Collard Melt is amazing! I rarely write reviews but the texture, acid and flavor of it all together is like fireworks in your mouth.
Great bologna sandwiches
Super nice waitstaff and amazing sandwiches, will definitely recommend to others and be returning myself. WOAH!
The fries are extra crispy with solid flavor. Favorite sandwich was the collard melt, which was messy but oh so good.

Fuuuuuu this place is good. We ordered with some friends and tried everything on the menu except the pasta salad. The collard melt is absolutely BOMB and the Amy n Nettie is super hearty and delicious. The sketti pocket is perfect fall comfort food. When ordering we thought it was a little pricey, but the size and quality was actually totally worth the prices. I didn’t try any drinks, but I’ll definitely be back to try some and grab some potato salad.

In the time I have spent on this planet, I have consumed many a sandwich. Carbohydrate. Filling. Carbohydrate. Such a confining formula. Or so I thought...  At 3PM today, I was gifted a brown paper bag. Within this bag resided items from a Phr3$h little sandwich shop by the name of “Big Kids”. Big Kids. Large children. Gargantuan adolescents.  Hm.  Certainly I, like many people who still drink chocolate milk and own an Incredible Hulk Pinball machine, could relate to this simple yet charming idea of humans who, though progressing in age, refuse to abandon the carefree delight and bewilderment that are so often associated with the spoils of youth.  GRUBS:  Amy N Nettie. Nothing but NETtie here. Such cohesion. I truly cannot recall a time where I have had a sandwich that effortlessly embraced a savory sweet dynamic. So many sandwiches are satisfied with having the main players of beef and cheese put the team on their back, but each of the condiments, from the onion to burnt tomato, participated in such a way to align the chakras of flavor most excellently.  Vietnamese Crunchwrap: From the three bites I stole from my partner, I was thoroughly impressed. As a practicing carnivore, my venturing into the unchartered waters of veganism was absolutely pleasant.  Kid Frys: I cannot even begin to decipher what’s going on here as the only way to sum this one up is “dayummmmmmm son.” Crispy, cheesy goodness with a lil’ kick throughout. No dip needed. Bountiful flavor in some tasty spud strips.  DRANK:  Ecto Cooler: Direct throwback to the aftermath of getting pummeled in Little Leagues when Jimmy’s mom would drag up the ol’ Coleman filled to the brim with Juice Boxes. This one brings the fun flavor of the diamond days with an adult twist that is nothing short of brilliantly original and delicious.  Groni: Classic cocktail done right. Have a hunch that there might be a Chicago classic that snuck its way into this one. Very clear that the bartender absolutely knows what is up.  In conclusion: I dig this a lot. You will undoubtedly dig it too. Let’s hope we see these righteous dudes and dudettes doing more than 4 days at a time soon because I could eat this 7 days a week.  Johnny Bravo.

WOAH! I've never had a sandwich like this. I got the Amy N Nettie and was blown away. The combination of flavors and how they layer through each bite is unreal. Every bite feels like a new experience as I notice different flavors that all just come together to perfection.  The pasta salad is on point. I usually give up on pasta salad after one or two mouthfuls, but I just couldn't stop eating it. Calling it "good" on their menu is a huge understatement.  Grabbed myself an Ecto Cooler (and they had other drinks for sale at the door) and whoever mixed the drink doesn't mess around. These suckers are STRONG and delicious. I can see myself getting into a lot of trouble drinking them.  And if the outstanding food wasn't enough, the entire staff are all stars. Girl working the door was so kind, cook who brought out my food was awesome, and the owner is one of the coolest and most genuine people I've ever met.  Go put your pre-order in now! They're going to sell out fast because this place absolutely SLAPS.
Do yourself a favor and place a pre-order for pick up. Cool humans and great grub.  See Connor Johnsons review for more info.
